axiom postulate statement true serve premise start point reasoning argument word Greek axíōma ἀξίωμα think worthy fit commend evident term subtle difference definition context field study define classic philosophy axiom statement evident well-established accept controversy question modern logic axiom premise start point reasoning mathematics term axiom related distinguishable sense logical axiom non-logical axiom logical axiom statement true logic define e. g. B imply symbolic form non-logical axiom e. g. substantive assertion element domain specific mathematical theory arithmetic sense axiom postulate assumption interchangeably non-logical axiom self-evident truth formal logical expression deduction build mathematical theory axiomatize knowledge claim derive well-understood set sentence axiom typically multiple axiomatize mathematical domain axiom statement serve start point statement logically derive meaningful mean axiom true subject debate philosophy mathematics EtymologyThe word axiom Greek word ἀξίωμα axíōma verbal noun verb ἀξιόειν axioein mean deem worthy require turn ἄξιος áxios mean balance value worthy proper ancient Greek philosopher axiom claim true proof root meaning word postulate demand instance Euclid demand agree e. g. point join straight line etc. ancient geometer maintain distinction axiom postulate comment Euclid 's book Proclus remark Geminus hold 4th postulate class postulate axiom postulate assert possibility construction express essential property Boethius translate postulate petitio axiom notiones commune late manuscript usage strictly historical developmentEarly GreeksThe logico-deductive Giovanni Girolamo Saccheri Italian pronunciation dʒoˈvanni dʒiˈrɔːlamo sakˈkɛːri September October Italian Jesuit priest scholastic philosopher mathematician Saccheri bear Sanremo enter Jesuit order
